wapreview
public class Wapreview
extends java.applet.Applet

see http://wapreview.sourceforge.net Copyright (C) 2000 Robert Fuller, Applepie Solutions Ltd. This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc., 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA Wapreview WML User Agent Applet

This applet exposes a set of public methods which allow the javascript component of Wapreview to access the java functionality responsible for retrieving and parsing the WML deck.

Once the WML deck has been retrieved and parsed, the javascript component calls upon this applet to perform actions on behalf of the user. These actions include:

  • Set the value of a variable
  • Get the value of a variable
  • Produce the (D)HTML used to render a card
  • Produce a javascript representation of intrinsic events:
    • onenterforward
    • onenterbackward
    • ontimer
  • Navigate to another WML card within this deck
  • Navigate to a card within an external WML deck via HTTP GET
  • Navigate to a card within an external WML deck via HTTP POST
  • Maintain state information
  • Maintain history

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Wapreview

public Wapreview()
Method Detail

getHref

public java.lang.String getHref(int index)
Returns the HREF at the specified index. The HREF will consist of a line of javascript which will be eval()'d by the javascript component of wapreview. The javascript returned by this method will have all variables expanded appropriately. This method is typically invoked when a user performs an action which triggers a dHTML event, eg: by clicking on a HTML link or by entering text in a textbox.
Parameters:
index - The index of the HREF to retrieve.

debug

public void debug(boolean onoff)
turn on or off debugging mode

selectitem

public boolean selectitem(java.lang.String group,
                          int itemno)
select (or unselect) an option in a select list... all display management is handled in javascript.

setVar

public void setVar(java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String value)
Sets the value of a WML variable. The variable of the specified name is set to the specified value. The value can be accessed by any card within the current deck.
Parameters:
name - The name of the variable.
value - The value to assign to the variable.

getVar

public java.lang.String getVar(java.lang.String name)
Returns the value of the named variable.
Parameters:
name - The name of the variable.

getCardData

public java.lang.String getCardData()
Returns the main content of the current WML card. The content of the card is returned in a format which can be rendered within the web browser in which the javascript component of wapreview is being interpreted.

getNavData

public java.lang.String getNavData()
Returns the navigational content of the current WML card. The navigational content of the card is returned in a format which can be rendered within the web browser in which the javascript component of wapreview is being interpreted. The javascript component of wapreview renders this content in a different HTML layer or div than the main content of the card.

getCardTimerValue

public int getCardTimerValue()
Returns the timer value of the timer for the current card. (-1 is returned if there is no timer) The javascript component of wapreview retrieves the timer value when the card displayed. If there is a timer value, the javascript component sets a timer, upon expiration of which the ontimer() event is triggered.

currentURL

public java.lang.String currentURL()
Returns the URL of the currently loaded deck

getSource

public java.lang.String getSource()
Returns the source WML for the currently loaded deck

reloadDeck

public void reloadDeck()
Causes the current deck to be reloaded. The http method and parameters used in reloading the deck will be the same as those used to retrieve the deck initially.

post

public void post(int index)
Retrieves a WML deck using an HTTP POST.
Parameters:
index - The index of the HREF to POST to.

setCard

public void setCard(java.lang.String url)
Sets the current card to the one specified. If the card specified begins with '#', the card will be sought within the current deck, otherwise a new deck will be created from the specified URL. If the url specifies a card within a deck (ie., it contains, but does not begin with '#'), the specified card will be the current card, otherwise the first card in the deck will used.
Parameters:
url - The url identifying the target card.

prevCard

public void prevCard()
Sets the current card to the previous card. This allows the user to navigate up the history stack.

onenterforward

public java.lang.String onenterforward()
Returns the javascript representation of the actions to be performed when an onenterforward event occurs on the current card. This javascript is eval()'d by the javascript component of wapreview.

onenterbackward

public java.lang.String onenterbackward()
Returns the javascript representation of the actions to be performed when an onenterbackward event occurs on the current card. This javascript is eval()'d by the javascript component of wapreview.

ontimer

public java.lang.String ontimer()
Returns the javascript representation of the actions to be performed when an ontimer event occurs on the current card. This javascript is eval()'d by the javascript component of wapreview.

homeurl

public java.lang.String homeurl()
Returns the a string contianing the URL used to identify the first deck retrieved by the applet.

init

public void init()
Initialises the applet. Two applet parameters are expected: a url for the image converter, and a url for the gateway.
Overrides:
init in class java.applet.Applet
